title: John Stamos facing possible jail time for DUI
text:
John Stamos facing possible jail time for DUI Compiled by Ann Tatko-Peterson Posted: 10/15/2015 09:29:36 AM PDT Updated: 10/15/2015 09:37:06 AM PDT Four months after his arrest, John Stamos was officially charged with DUI in Los Angeles. 
The Los Angeles District Attorney told E! News on Thursday that the 52-year-old star of the sitcom "Grandfathered" faces a misdemeanor count of driving under the influence of drugs. On June 12, Stamos was pulled over for reckless driving in Beverly Hills and later arrested at the hospital for DUI. 
The maximum sentence, if convicted, is six months in county jail. 
TMZ recently reported that Stamos was taking GHB, also known as the date-rape drug, to "lean out mass" in preparation for his role on "Grandfathered." 
A month after his arrest, Stamos checked into a monthlong treatment program for substance abuse at an undisclosed rehab facility. 
He tweeted after his release: "I'm back! Took a month to take care of things. Healthy. Feeling grateful for the love & support of family & friends." 
In an interview later with Details magazine, Stamos admitted that he had a rough year after his mother died in September 2014. He called the arrest a "turning point." 
"You either continue on that path -- and some of it's fun, but a lot of it's not -- or there's this other thing, this golden opportunity sitting there with all this work and all this goodwill that you have going for you," he told the magazine. "That's the key. I feel better than I've felt in a decade." Ann Tatko-Peterson provides celebrity commentary for the Bay Area News Group. Follow her at twitter.com/atatkopeterson . Advertisement
